element.desc: Returns the element the watcher is watching.
element.doc:
Returns the element the watcher is watching.

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The element the watcher is watching.
element.name: element
returns: * The element the watcher is watching.

pid.desc: Returns the PID of the element being watched
pid.doc:
Returns the PID of the element being watched

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The PID of the element being watched
pid.name: pid
returns: * The PID of the element being watched

start.desc: Tells the watcher to start watching for the given list of events.
start.doc:
Tells the watcher to start watching for the given list of events.

Parameters:
 * An array of events to be watched for.

Returns:
 * hs.uielement.watcher

Notes:
 * See hs.uielement.watcher for a list of events. You may also specify arbitrary event names as strings.
 * Does nothing if the watcher has already been started. To start with different events, stop it first.
start.name: start
notes: * See hs.uielement.watcher for a list of events. You may also specify arbitrary event names as strings.
* Does nothing if the watcher has already been started. To start with different events, stop it first.
parameters: * An array of events to be watched for.

stop.desc: Tells the watcher to stop listening for events.
stop.doc:
Tells the watcher to stop listening for events.

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * hs.uielement.watcher

Notes:
 * This is automatically called if the element is destroyed.
stop.name: stop
notes: * This is automatically called if the element is destroyed.
